intro: Protorhus ditimena, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, often found on tree trunks or rocks in humid environments. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
